conclusion: Objects A and B are moved through the air to be placed on top of the locations of objects C, D, E, and F.
Objects C and D are blue blocks, and E and F are a green and yellow block, respectively.
Gravity causes objects A and B to come into contact with objects C, D, E, and F, transferring their weight to these objects.
Objects C and D are under object A, and the weight of A causes these blocks to be pressed down.
Objects E and F are under object B, and the weight of B causes these blocks to be pressed down.
The blocks C, D, E, and F are pressed down by the weight of A and B, causing the fabric covering them to sag in the middle where the weight is applied.
The fabric covering the blocks is checkered and black.
The sagging of the fabric indicates that the weight has deformed the fabric, showing the pressure points.
The images demonstrate the sagging fabrics, confirming that the weight of objects A and B has pressed down on C, D, E, and F.
The fabric sags in the middle due to the weight of objects A and B pressing down on objects C, D, E, and F.
